II.iii.2.F.1.b
.
Acceptable Means for Requesting Withdrawal of a Claim
There is no prescribed form for withdrawing a claim.  VA accepts requests for withdrawal of a claim that a claimant or authorized representative submits
in writing (a signed statement)
orally (in person or by telephone), or
electronically.
The request must contain enough information to identify the claim at issue, including the name of the Veteran and claimant (if the claimant is not the Veteran) and the corresponding file number.
Important
:  Follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 2.D.1.e
when accepting a request for withdrawal of a claim by telephone.
References
:  For more information on
the requirements for withdrawing
decision reviews (including HLRs and supplemental claims), see
38 CFR 3.2500(d)
, and
M21-5, Chapter 4, Topic 4
appeals under the jurisdiction of BVA, see
38 CFR 20.205
, and
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section A.3.e
, and
legacy appeals, see
38 CFR 19.55
, and
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section A.3
, and
VA claim submission service websites, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 4
.
title: M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section F - Withdrawal of Initial Claims
citation: Part II, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section F
